entries.title: Wave of Russian attacks target Ukraine civilians, power grid
entries.description: At least five killed and power supplies disrupted in most regions of Ukraine in the wake of Russian raids.

entries.title: Ankara says time running out to ratify Sweden, Finland NATO bids
entries.description: Presidential spokesman says Sweden needs to fulfil requirements before May, when the polls in Turkey will take place.

entries.title: Russia’s Medvedev says Japanese PM should disembowel himself
entries.description: Former president once seen as a reformer has reinvented himself as an arch-hawk since Russia invaded Ukraine last year.

entries.title: More classified files found at Biden’s home: White House
entries.description: The White House says five additional pages with classified markings discovered at the president's Delaware home.

entries.title: What do we know about new COVID variant XBB.1.5?
entries.description: The Omicron subvariant XBB.1.5 has been reported in dozens of countries and has been called the most transmissible yet.

entries.title: Thousands protest Israeli gov’t plans to overhaul legal system
entries.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has made reform of the legal system a centrepiece of his agenda.

entries.title: Does the battle for Soledar mark a new phase in the Ukraine war?
entries.description: Ukraine has refuted Russian claims its forces have captured the eastern town of Soledar.

entries.title: Russia’s frenzied fight for Ukraine’s strategic eastern towns
entries.description: Capturing Bakhmut would be a tremendous 'morale booster' for the Russian war effort after a series of setbacks.

entries.title: UK pledges to provide battle tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak promises to send Challenger 2 tanks after phone call with Ukraine leader Zelenskyy.

entries.title: Greta Thunberg joins anti-coal activists to save German village
entries.description: Activists march in Luetzerath against a plan to tear down the village to build a coal mine extension.

entries.title: Former Bolsonaro justice minister arrested over Brazil riots
entries.description: Anderson Torres was Brasilia security chief when rioters attacked government buildings in the city.

entries.title: It is not true that Pelé did not fight racism
entries.description: Throughout his life, the Brazilian football star stood up to oppression, inspiring Black people at home and abroad.

entries.title: China reports almost 60,000 COVID-related deaths in past month
entries.description: From December 8 to January 12, deaths related to the virus in Chinese hospitals totalled 59,938.

entries.title: Tunisia: Anti-gov’t protests take place on revolution anniversary
entries.description: Demonstrators in Tunis marked 12 years since the Arab Spring revolution erupted across the region.

entries.title: Football Kenya suspends 16 players, coaches for match-fixing
entries.description: Football Kenya Federation says one player from reigning Kenyan premiership side Tusker was among those suspended.

entries.title: Two Palestinians shot dead by Israel troops in occupied West Bank
entries.description: The deaths bring this year's Palestinian toll to 12 as Israel has been engaged in deadly raids for nearly a year.

entries.title: Riots in Brazil: Bolsonarism is down but not out
entries.description: A conspiracy-fuelled mob targets the seat of government in Brazil after Lula is sworn in. Plus, Italian Mafia on TikTok.

entries.title: Tanzania opposition leader to end exile after rally ban lifted
entries.description: Former presidential candidate Lissu says he will return home on January 25 and 'get back to work'.

entries.title: Australian Open: Ons Jabeur hoping to ‘not lose any more finals’
entries.description: Ahead of the Australian Open, the Tunisian trailblazer said she is aiming to fulfil her Grand Slam ambitions.

entries.title: FIFA to investigate Argentina over World Cup final behaviour
entries.description: FIFA says Argentina potentially breached rules regarding 'offensive behaviour' and fair play.

entries.title: Jamaica launches fraud probe after Bolt reports millions missing
entries.description: Millions of dollars were reported missing from the Olympic champion's account at a private wealth management company.

entries.title: UN Security Council members urge Taliban to void bans on women
entries.description: Eleven members of the UNSC call on the group to reverse restrictive policies on women's and girls' education and work.

entries.title: Peru president will not resign, apologises for protest death toll
entries.description: More than 40 people have been killed and hundreds injured in protests that have rocked Peru since December.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 325
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 325th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: What does China’s reopening mean for the economy?
entries.description: China’s zero-COVID policy is over. Despite a surge in infections, the nation opened its doors to the rest of the world.

entries.title: Iran hangs former defence ministry official for spying for UK
entries.description: Iranian-British dual national was found guilty of being a spy for Britain’s MI-6 intelligence agency.

entries.title: Indonesia deploys warship to monitor China coast guard vessel
entries.description: A warship, maritime patrol plane and drone have been deployed to monitor the Chinese vessel in the North Natuna Sea.

entries.title: Republicans probe chaotic US military withdrawal from Afghanistan
entries.description: About 2,500 US soldiers died in Afghanistan, a conflict that became the longest war the United States fought.

entries.title: Brazil top court to investigate Bolsonaro role in anti-Lula riots
entries.description: Probe will look at his 'instigation and intellectual authorship of the anti-democratic acts' that 'resulted' in riots.

entries.title: Zelenskyy mocks Russian forces fighting for ‘credit’ over Soledar
entries.description: Head of the Wagner mercenary group had accused Russia's military establishment of trying to 'steal victory' in Soledar.

entries.title: Japan, US and Europe must act together on China, PM Kishida says
entries.description: If Russia's use of force goes 'unchallenged, it will happen elsewhere in the world, including Asia', Japan's PM says.

entries.title: US to send delegation for law enforcement talks to Cuba
entries.description: Talks come as the administration of US President Joe Biden eases relations with the Caribbean nation.
